text: Nick Mourouzis (April 16, 1937 – September 16, 2020)https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/indystar/obituary.aspx?n=nick- mourouzis&pid;=196822380&fhid;=13888 was an American football player and coach. He served as the head football coach at DePauw University in Greencastle, Indiana, from 1981 to 2003, compiling a record of 133–82–4. As a college football player, Mourouzis was a starting quarterback at Miami University in Oxford, Ohio. ==Biography== Nick Mourouzis was born on April 16, 1937, in Tuscarawas County, Ohio. He played football and baseball in high school, and was discovered by Ara Parseghian who recruited him to play for Miami University. He graduated from Miami in 1959, and received his Master's Degree in 1961. In 1971, he received another Master's Degree from Indiana University. Mourouzis served as the head football coach at DePauw University in Greencastle, Indiana from 1981 to 2003, compiling a record of 133–82–4. In 1996, Mourouzis founded Chi Alpha Sigma Honor Society for Student-Athletes.Chi Alpha Sigma - About On September 16, 2020 Mourouzis died from complications of COVID-19 aged 83 in Greencastle, Indiana. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:People from Tuscarawas County, Ohio Category:Coaches of American football from Ohio Category:Players of American football from Ohio Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Ball State Cardinals football coaches Category:DePauw Tigers football coaches Category:Indiana Hoosiers football coaches Category:Miami RedHawks football players Category:Northwestern Wildcats football coaches Category:Ohio Bobcats football coaches Category:Miami University alumni Category:Indiana University alumni Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Indiana
title: Nick Mourouzis
